item.title: US government is reportedly in discussions to take stake in Intel
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: This deal would be meant to help Intel bulk up its U.S. chip manufacturing, including its much-delayed Ohio factory.

item.title: What is Bluesky? Everything to know about the X competitor
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: We’ve compiled the answers to some of the most common questions users have about Bluesky.

item.title: The wait is almost over: The 2025 Startup Battlefield 200 list drops August 27
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: After reviewing thousands of groundbreaking applications from around the globe, TechCrunch is just days away from announcing the 2025 Startup Battlefield 200.

item.title: Bluesky rolls out massive revamp to policies and Community Guidelines
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Some of the changes represent an effort by Bluesky to purposefully shape its community and the behavior of its users, nudging them to be nicer and more respectful of others.

item.title: Norway spy chief blames Russian hackers for hijacking dam
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The Russian hackers used their access to the dam's computer systems to open a floodgate that spilled millions of gallons of water.

item.title: Cohere hits a $6.8B valuation as investors AMD, Nvidia, and Salesforce double down
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Cohere's market proposition has always been to offer secure LLMs specifically geared for enterprise use, not for consumers.

item.title: Pixel 10, AI capabilities, and everything else we expect out of the Made by Google 2025 event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Dive into what we can expect from the Made by Google 2025 event, where the tech giant will debut its Pixel 10 lineup.

item.title: iPhone 17, the ‘thinnest iPhone ever,’ and everything else we’re expecting out of Apple’s hardware event
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: From a new slim iPhone Air model to redesigned AirPods, here's what to expect from this year's Apple event.

item.title: Kodak denies it’s shutting down amid media reports of financial struggles
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Kodak strikes back at media reports suggesting it may go out of business or file for bankruptcy (again).

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer, Kate Park
item.description: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

item.title: Lovable projects $1B in ARR within next 12 months
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Lovable is a vibe coding startup growing phenomenally quickly, according to new sales projections from CEO Anton Osika.

item.title: Leaked Meta AI rules show chatbots were allowed to have romantic chats with kids
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: The standards also allow the bots to make "statements that demean people on the basis of their protected characteristics," such as "black people are dumber than white people."

item.title: Buzzy AI startup Multiverse creates two of the smallest high-performing models ever
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: It humorously calls this family the Model Zoo because one is like the size of a fly's brain and the other the size of a chicken's.

item.title: Google pushes AI into flight deals as antitrust scrutiny, competition heat up
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Google has launched Flight Deals as its AI tool within Google Flights to help travelers find cheaper fares.

item.title: AI translation tech Palabra gets backing from Reddit co-founder’s venture firm
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Alexis Ohanian and his firm Seven Seven Six are backing Palabra, which is working on a translation engine.

item.title: Cohere hires long-time Meta research head Joelle Pineau as its chief AI officer
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Cohere has hired Joelle Pineau, Meta's former VP of AI research who previously oversaw the tech giant's fundamental AI research (FAIR) lab. In her newly created Chief AI Officer role, Pineau will oversee AI strategy across Cohere's research, product, and policy teams.

item.title: Inside the Box: Aaron Levie on reinvention at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Aaron Levie of Box joins the Disrupt Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 in October.

item.title: Apple’s blood oxygen monitoring returns to its latest Apple Watches
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The change doesn’t affect previously sold models with the original version of the feature or units bought outside the U.S.

item.title: Airbnb will allow US users to book stays without paying up front
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Airbnb has launched a new feature called "Reserve Now, Pay Later" that lets users in the U.S. reserve a property without paying up front, potentially allowing people to cancel their bookings with less hassle if their plans change.

item.title: Co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI departs the company
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Igor Babuschkin is leaving xAI less than three years after he co-founded the startup with Elon Musk, following a series of scandals at company.
